snippet: More than 2,000 prisoners held by the Syrian authorities were being released in return for 48 Iranians held by rebels for months, Turkish and Iranian news reports said.
abstract: Turkish and Iranian officials say that more than 2,000 prisoners held by Syrian authorities are being released in return for 48 Iranians held by rebels for months, in what appears to be biggest prisoner swap since uprising against Pres Bashar al-Assad began.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, Alan Cowell from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: More than 2,000 prisoners held by the Syrian authorities were being released in return for 48 Iranians held by rebels for months, Turkish and Iranian news reports said.

headline.seo: Iranian Captives Freed in Major Prisoner Exchange in Syria
headline.main: Iranian Captives Freed in Prisoner Exchange in Syria
headline.print_headline: Iranian Captives Freed in Syrian Prisoner Exchange

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
